detaileddescription.para: The experiment's name catalog for ensuring uniqueness of simulation object names within a single experiment.
Flag indicating at least one error or warning has occurred.
Flag indicating to suppress notifications like 'experiment started'.
The description of this Experiment
Flag indicating if the simulation is running.
The model to be run by this experiment.
The distribution manager for the model's distributions.
The message manager for the model's messages.
The ThreadGroup for this Experiment.
The list to register all OutputType objects to close them after finishing the Experiment.
The list to register all FileOutput objects to close them after finishing the Experiment.
The resource database storing all resource allocations and requests. Also needed to detect deadlocks.
The TimeInstant when the experiment is supposed to stop. Is initially null and will be set only if the user provides a time limit.
The event to stop the experiment. Is initially null and will be set only if the user provides a time limit.
A list of Conditions which cause the experiment to stop. The user has to implement the check() method of the Conditions in order to effectively stop an experiment.
Flag indicating whether a progressbar for this experiment should be displayed or not.
Specifies an output path for the report files (Modification by Nicolas Knaak, 02/2001)
Delay between steps of the scheduler in milliseconds. Necessary for online observation of experiments in FAMOS. (Modification by Nicolas Knaak, 07/2001)
The real time (wallclock time) start time of the simulation run. (Modification by Felix Klueckmann, 05/2009)
The output types of the debug channel.
The output types of the report channel.
The output types of the error channel.
The output types of the trance channel.
A potential interruption of experiment executions (otherwise null).
The default report output
The default trace output
The default error output
The default debug output
Status of an Experiment just created without any accessories created yet.
Status of an Experiment instantiated with all needed accessories available.
Status of an Experiment connected to a Model and ready to be started.
Status of an Experiment being started. Only if an Experiment is
Status of an Experiment stopped after having run.
Status of an Experiment currently running the simulation.
Status of an Experiment finished and to be cleared.
The last suffix used with filenames when creating multiple batch runs of an experiment.
The class reference to messages of type desmoj.core.report.TraceNote
The class reference to messages of type desmoj.core.report.DebugNote
The class reference to messages of type desmoj.core.report.ErrorMessage
The class reference to messages of type desmoj.core.report.Reporter
The scheduler used for this experiment.

Constructs a new Experiment with a given name. Data channel output (report, error, debug, trace) will either be written to HTML files in the current directory. Epsilon (granularity of simulation) defaults to a microsecond, reference time (default time unit) to a second.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. Experiment name can be specified. Data channel output (report, error, debug, trace) will either be suppressed or written to HTML files in the current directory. Epsilon (granularity of simulation) defaults to a microsecond, reference time (default time unit) to a second.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
boolean : This flag indicates if the experiment should write output files in the default format (HTML) or no output files at all.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. Experiment name and output path can be specified. Data channel output (report, error, debug, trace) will either be written to HTML files, epsilon (granularity of simulation) defaults to a microsecond, reference time (default time unit) to a second.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, TimeUnit epsilon, TimeUnit referenceUnit, TimeFormatter formatter)
memberdef.name: Experiment

detaileddescription.para:
Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. This is a shortcut constructor. Parameters for the name, the granularity(epsilon), the reference time unit and a time formatter are needed. All other possible settings are set to default values. These settings for an experiment without special ExperimentOptions are:
seed = 979 : The initial seed setting for the seed-generator
The default stop condition for this experiment will never interfere, always returning false.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit: The granularity of simulation time.
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit : In statements without an explicit declaration of a TimeUnit the reference unit is used.
desmoj.core.simulator.TimeFormatter: Defines how time values will be formatted in the output files.

simplesect.para: java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, String pathName, String reportOutputType, String traceOutputType, String errorOutputType, String debugOutputType)
memberdef.name: Experiment

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. Experiment name, output path and a single file type per output channel can be specified. Epsilon (granularity of simulation) defaults to a microsecond, reference time (default time unit) to a second.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, String pathName, TimeUnit epsilon, TimeUnit referenceUnit, TimeFormatter formatter, String reportOutputType, String traceOutputType, String errorOutputType, String debugOutputType)
memberdef.name: Experiment

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. Experiment name, output path, epsilon, reference time unit, time format, can be specified. Same holds for file output channels, though this constructor assumes a single file type per output channel.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit: The granularity of simulation time.
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit : In statements without an explicit declaration of a TimeUnit the reference unit is used.
desmoj.core.simulator.TimeFormatter: Defines how time values will be formatted in the output files.

simplesect.para: java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, String outputPath, TimeUnit epsilon, TimeUnit referenceUnit, TimeFormatter formatter, ArrayList< String > reportOutputs, ArrayList< String > traceOutputs, ArrayList< String > errorOutputs, ArrayList< String > debugOutputs)
memberdef.name: Experiment

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. This is the most flexible constructor. Experiment name, output path, epsilon, reference time unit, time format, and multiple file types per output channel can be specified.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit: The granularity of simulation time.
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit : In statements without an explicit declaration of a TimeUnit the reference unit is used.
desmoj.core.simulator.TimeFormatter: Defines how time values will be formatted in the output files.

simplesect.para: java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, String outputPath, ArrayList< String > reportOutputs, ArrayList< String > traceOutputs, ArrayList< String > errorOutputs, ArrayList< String > debugOutputs)
memberdef.name: Experiment

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new Experiment with the given parameters. Experiment name, output path and a multiple file type per output channel can be specified. Epsilon (granularity of simulation) defaults to a microsecond, reference time (default time unit) to a second.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files

detaileddescription.para: Adds a messagereceiver for debugnotes to the experiment. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will also be sent to the given messagereceiver for further processing. Note that the given receiver must be capable of handling debugnotes.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver for the given type of messages

detaileddescription.para: Adds a messagereceiver for error messages to the experiment. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will also be sent to the given messagereceiver for further processing. Note that the given receiver must be capable of handling messagereceiver.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver for the given type of messages

detaileddescription.para: Adds a messagereceiver for the given subtype of message to the experiment. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will also be sent to the given messagereceiver for further processing.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver for the given type of messages
Class : The type of message to be sent to the given messagereceiver

detaileddescription.para: Adds a messagereceiver for tracenotes to the experiment. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will also be sent to the given messagereceiver for further processing. Note that the given Receiver must be capable of handling tracenotes.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver for the given type of messages

detaileddescription.para: Returns a boolean indicating whether debug notes are forwarded to the debug ouput or not. Debug ouput can be switched on and off using the methods debugOn(TimeInstant startTime) or debugOff(TimeInstant stopTime)

simplesect.para: boolean

detaileddescription.para: Switches the debug output off at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch off debug

xrefdescription.para: Use debugOff(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the debug output off at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch debug off

detaileddescription.para: Switches the debug output on at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch on debug

xrefdescription.para: Use debugOn(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the debug output on at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch debug on

detaileddescription.para: Switches the debug output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no debug output at all!

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch debug on
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch debug off

xrefdescription.para: Replaced by debugTime(TimeInstant a, TimeInstant b). Switches the debug output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no debug output at all!

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch debug on
SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch debug off

detaileddescription.para: De-registers a file at the experiment. Registered files will be flushed and closed after the experiment has finished. If the file is manually closed by the user and has been registered at the Experiment, deRegister it

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.FileOutput : The file to be closed with the end of an Experiment

detaileddescription.para: Stopps all running simprocesses that might still be scheduled and closes the output files.
Returns the distributionmanager for this experiment. Distributions need access to the distributionmanager for handling antithetic modes, resetting and their initial seeds.

simplesect.para: desmoj.dist.DistributionManager : The distributionmanager for this experiment

detaileddescription.para: Returns the epsilon value representing the granularity of simulation time for this experiment. So far, Hour, Minute, Second and Millisecond are supported. Default (unless set explicitly) is TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS.

simplesect.para: TimeUnit : The Granularity of the simulation time

xrefdescription.para: Use getEpsilonUnit(). Returns a SimTime representation of the granularity of simulation time for this experiment. So far, Hour, Minute, Second and Millisecond are supported.

simplesect.para: SimTime : The Granularity of the simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current execution Speed Rate.

simplesect.para: double : The current execution speed rate.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the messagemanager for this experiment. Messages need access to the MessageManager for distributing the messages to one or more specified output streams.

simplesect.para: desmoj.dist.MessageManager : The messagemanager for this experiment

detaileddescription.para: Returns the model that is connected to this experiment or null if no model is connected so far.

simplesect.para: Model : The model that this experiment is connected to or null if no connection is established.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the name of the path the experiment's report-, trace-, debug- and error-files are written to.

simplesect.para: String the experiment's output path

detaileddescription.para: Returns the reference unit for this experiment. This is the time unit mapped to a time step of 1.0 in simulation time. So far, Hour, Minute, Second and Millisecond are supported. Default (unless set explicitly) is TimeUnit.SECONDS.

simplesect.para: TimeUnit : The reference unit.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the resource database for this experiment. The Res objects need access to the resource database to note their resource allocations and requests and for deadlock detection.

simplesect.para: desmoj.ResourceDB : the resource database storing all resource allocations and requests.
Soenke Claassen

detaileddescription.para: Returns the scheduler for this experiment. ModelComponents need access to the scheduler for identifying the current active entity or process and to schedule themselves or other schedulables to activate at a given time in the future.

simplesect.para: Scheduler : The scheduler for this experiment

detaileddescription.para: Returns the simclock for this experiment. ModelComponents need access to the simclock for retrieveing the current simulation time.

simplesect.para: SimCLock : The simclock for this experiment

detaileddescription.para: Returns the TimeInstant when the experiment is expected to stop running.

simplesect.para: TimeInstant : The time at which the experiment is expected to stop running.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the Conditions which can cause an experiment to stop. May be empty if there are no such Conditions.

simplesect.para: Condition
Tim Janz

detaileddescription.para: Removes all conditions set to stop the experiment.

xrefdescription.para: Depends on TimeFormatter in use. Returns the experiment's number of floating point digits of simulation time that are displayed in the various output files, as read from the SingleUnitTimeFormatter, if in use. Otherwise, 0 will be returned.

simplesect.para: int : The number of floating point digits of simulation time to be displayed in output files

detaileddescription.para: Displays the current state of the simulation run. If an experient is aborted, it can not be proceeded. All SimThreads still active are stopped, the main routine can finish.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the simulation is aborted, false if it has not started yet or is still running

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this experiment has already been connected to a model.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true, if experiment is connected to a model, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this experiment has not run yet.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true, if experiment is not running yet, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Returns if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not. Default is not.

simplesect.para: boolean: true if concurrent Events are randomized, false otherwise
Ruth Meyer

detaileddescription.para: Displays the current state of the simulation run.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the simulation is running, false if it has not started yet or has already finished

detaileddescription.para: Returns if a progress bar should be displayed for this experiment or not.

simplesect.para: boolean :true if a progress bar should be displayed for this experiment, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Displays the current state of the simulation run. If an experient is stopped, it can be proceeded by calling proceed().

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true, if experiment is stopped, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Determines whether or not an error or warning has yet occurred during this experiment.

simplesect.para: boolean : True if at least one error has occurred in the model connected to this experiment or one of its submodels, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Proceeds with a stopped experiment. An experiment can be stopped, if either its status is changed from RUNNING to some other state, the scheduler runs out of scheduled events or if the check() method of the given stop Condition returns true after an event has been processed.
Sets the delay between each step of the scheduler.

parameterdescription.para: : Delay time in milliseconds as a long value

simplesect.para: Nicolas Knaak

detaileddescription.para: Returns the delay between each step of the scheduler

simplesect.para: A long value representing the delay time in milliseconds
Nicolas Knaak

detaileddescription.para: Registers a file output (Report, Trace, Error, Debug) in specific formats (e.g. HTML, ASCII, XML) at the experiment. Registered files will be flushed and closed after the experiment has finished. This is handy for modellers producing their own output who want their files to be closed at the end of the experiment.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.FileOutput : The file to be closed with the end of an experiment

detaileddescription.para: Registers a custom file output at the experiment, e.g. TimeSeries plotting data to a file. Registered files will be flushed and closed after the experiment has finished. This is handy for modellers producing their own output who want their files to be closed at the end of the experiment.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.FileOutput : The file to be closed with the end of an experiment

detaileddescription.para: Removes a messagereceiver for debugnotes from the experiment's messagedistributor. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will not be sent to the given messagereceiver anymore. Note that if the messagereceiver is also registered for other types of messages, these will not be affected. Use method removeReceiverAll(MessageReceiver msgRec) to remove a messagereceiver from all types of messages.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver to be removed from the messagedistributor's list for the given messagetype

detaileddescription.para: Removes a messagereceiver for errormessages from the experiment's messagedistributor. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will not be sent to the given messagereceiver anymore. Note that if the messagereceiver is also registered for other types of messages, these will not be affected. Use method removeReceiverAll(MessageReceiver msgRec) to remove a messagereceiver from all types of messages.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver to be removed from the vessagedistributor's list for the given messagetype

detaileddescription.para: Removes a messagereceiver from the experiment's messagedistributor. The given messagereceiver will not receive messages of any type any more Use method removeReceiver(MessageReceiver msgRec, Class messageType) to remove the messagereceiver from one type of messages only.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver to be removed from the messagedistributor's list for the given messagetype

detaileddescription.para: Removes a messagereceiver for the given subtype of message from the Experiment's messagedistributor. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will not be sent to the given messagereceiver anymore. Note that if the messagereceiver is also registered for other types of messages, these will not be affected. Use method removeReceiverAll(MessageReceiver msgRec) to remove a messagereceiver from all types of messages.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver to be removed from the messagedistributor's list for the given messagetype
Class : The type of message not to be sent to the given messagereceiver

detaileddescription.para: Removes a messagereceiver for tracenotes from the experiment's messagedistributor. Whenever a model produces a message of that type, it will not be sent to the given messagereceiver anymore. Note that if the messagereceiver is also registered for other types of messages, these will not be affected. Use method removeReceiverAll(MessageReceiver msgRec) to remove a messagereceiver from all types of messages.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.report.MessageReceiver : The new messagereceiver to be removed from the messagedistributor's list for the given messagetype

detaileddescription.para: Overrides inherited NamedObjectImp.rename(String newName) method to prevent the user from changing the experiment's name during an experiment. Renaming is not allowed with experiments, since it would not allow the user to identify the reports produced by an experiment. The method simply returns without changing the experiment's name, ignoring the given parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The parameter given is not taken as the new name, method simply returns

detaileddescription.para: Writes a report about the model connected top this experiment, its reportable components and all related submodels into the report output. Note that a report can only be produced, if a valid main model is already connected to the experiment.

Writes a report about the given model which has to be connected to this experiment as main model or as a submodel. Note that this will report about a branch of the tree of submodels constructed. A report will only be produced, if the model given is connected to this experiment. All reportable components of this model and all related submodels will be sent to the report output configured at the experiment's messagedistributor. Note that a report can only be produced, if a valid main model is already connected to the experiment.

Determines if the event-list processes concurrent Events in random order or not. Default is not, i.e. when a new experiment is constructed, the event-list is set to "linear" order. Note: If you want the event-list to randomize concurrent Events you should call this method BEFORE scheduling any events. Otherwise any connections between events established via scheduleBefore() or scheduleAfter() are lost. So it's a good idea to call this method only once and right after constructing the experiment.

parameterdescription.para: boolean :true forces random order, false forces "linear" order

simplesect.para: Ruth Meyer

detaileddescription.para: Sets the speed rate for an execution that is proportional to wall-clock time (real time). Set the speed rate to a value bigger than zero for a simulation that will progress proportional to wall-clock time. The following equation applies for speed rates >0 : rate*simulation time = wallclock-time. If the speed rate is 0 or less the simulation will be executed as fast as possible. Default is 0 (as-fast-as-possible).

parameterdescription.para: double : The execution speed rate

detaileddescription.para: Sets the seed of the SeedGenerator to the given value. If the seed is not set here, its default is 979, unless specified different in the ExperimentOptions.

parameterdescription.para: long : The seed for the SeedGenerator

detaileddescription.para: Sets the underlying pseudo random number generator to be used by all distributions created from now on. The default generator is LinearCongruentialRandomGenerator; any other generator to be used must implement the interface UniformRandomGenerator.

parameterdescription.para: Class : The random number generator class to be used

detaileddescription.para: Sets the new value for showing the progress bar for this experiment or not.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : set it to true if a progress bar should be displayed; for not showing the progress bar of this experiment set it to false.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the new value for displaying basic experiment notifications like 'experiment started', 'experiment stopped' oder 'experiment resumed' at the system output.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : set it to true to suppress notifications or false to print them.

detaileddescription.para: Starts the simulation with default start time 0. This method can only be used once on an experiment. it initializes the connected model and starts the simulation. Note that in order to stop the simulation, the stop(TimeInstant stopTime) method has to be called first!

Starts the experiment with the given simulation time as starting time. The experiment will not start unless a valid model has been connected to it before. Note that in order to stop the simulation at some point of time, the stop method has to be called first. StopCondition s can be given alternatively.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The starting time instant

xrefdescription.para: Use start(TimeInstant initTime). Starts the experiment with the given simulation time as starting time. The experiment will not start unless a valid model has been connected to it before. Note that in order to stop the simulation at some point of time, the stop method has to be called first. StopCondition s can be given alternatively.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The starting time instant

detaileddescription.para: Specifies a ModelCondition to stop the simulation. Note that this methode can be called muliple times, defining alternative conditions to terminate the simulation. Once at least one of the conditions passed using this method returns true, the experiment will stop. Beware that the simulation will run endlessly if none of the conditions are met; thus it is recommended to additionally always use a time limit if none of the conditions in question can be proven to be met during the run of the simulation!

parameterdescription.para: ModelCondition : A condition to stop the simulation once it's check() methode returns true.

detaileddescription.para: Specifies a Condition to stop the simulation.

parameterdescription.para: Condition<?> : A condition to stop the simulation once it's check() methode returns true.

detaileddescription.para: Stops the simulation at the given point of simulation time. If no valid simulation time is given, the default is 0 which would not let the simulation run past that time. Repeatedly calling this method will override stop times specified before.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.TimeInstant : The point of simulation time to stop the simulation

xrefdescription.para: Stops the simulation at the given point of simulation time. If no valid simulation time is given, the default is 0.0 which would not let the simulation run past that time.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimTime : The point of simulation time to stop the simulation

detaileddescription.para: Stops the simulation at the current simulation time (immediately). A stopped Simulation run can be resumed by calling proceed().

Returns a boolean indicating whether trace notes are forwarded to the trace ouput or not. Trace ouput can be switched on and off using the methods traceOn(TimeInstant startTime) and traceOff(TimeInstant stopTime)

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true

detaileddescription.para: Switches the trace output off at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch trace off

xrefdescription.para: Use traceOff(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the trace output off at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch trace off

detaileddescription.para: Switches the trace output on at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch trace on

xrefdescription.para: Use traceOn(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the trace output on at the given point of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch trace on

detaileddescription.para: Switches the trace output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no trace output at all.

parameterdescription.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch trace on
TimeInstant : The point in simulation time to switch trace off

xrefdescription.para: Replaced by tracePeriod(TimeInstant startTime, TimeInstant stopTime). Switches the trace output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no trace output at all.

parameterdescription.para: SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch trace on
SimTime : The point in simulation time to switch trace off

detaileddescription.para: Triggers the reporters of the given model or submodel to write their report data into the report output registered at the experiment's messagemanager. The string given will be added as a suffix to the report filename to help identify teh report when more than one report is produced by one Experiment at differnet points of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Model
java.lang.String : Suffix for report filename if multiple reports are drawn

detaileddescription.para: Triggers the reporters to write their data into the report output registered at the experiment's messagemanager. The string given will be added as a suffix to the report filename to help identification when more than one report is produced by one Experiment at differnet points of simulation time.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : Suffix for report filename if multiple reports are drawn

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, String outputPath, TimeUnit epsilon, TimeUnit referenceUnit, TimeFormatter formatter, ArrayList< String > reportOutputs, ArrayList< String > traceOutputs, ArrayList< String > errorOutputs, ArrayList< String > debugOutputs)
memberdef.name: setupExperiment

detaileddescription.para: Private helper method to initialize the experiment; should be called from all constructors.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the experiment determining the outputfile's names, too. So please avoid characters that your local filesystem does not support in filenames.
java.lang.String : The output path for report files
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit: The granularity of simulation time.
java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit : In statements without an explicit declaration of a TimeUnit the reference unit is used.
desmoj.core.simulator.TimeFormatter: Defines how time values will be formatted in the output files.

simplesect.para: java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit

detaileddescription.para: Creates a scheduler for this experiment.

parameterdescription.para: experiment name

simplesect.para: a new scheduler

detaileddescription.para: Interrupts experiment execution in case a fatal problem prevents the experiment from being continued.

parameterdescription.para: DESMOJException : The exception that caused the interrupt

detaileddescription.para: Returns the experiments name catalog for ensuring unique names of simulation objects within a single experiment.

Returns the threadgroup associated to this experiment. All Threads are associated to this threadgroup to get control of their number and state and to have a means to differentiate them from possible other experiments' threads.

simplesect.para: java.lang.ThreadGroup

detaileddescription.para: Connects a model to this experiment. The given model must not be submodel of other models and not already be connected to some other experiment. Otherwise an errormessage will be given and the experiment will be stopped.

Creates and sends a debugnote to the messagedistributor. Be sure to have a correct location, since the object and method that the error becomes apparent is not necessary the location it was produced in. The information about the simulation time is extracted from the Experiment and must not be given as a parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the error that occured

detaileddescription.para: Sends a message to the messagedistributor. Note that there are other shorthands for sending the standard DESMO-J messages.

parameterdescription.para: Message : The Message to be transmitted

memberdef.argsstring: (String description, String location, String reason, String prevention)
memberdef.name: sendWarning

detaileddescription.para: Creates and sends an error message to the messagedistributor to warn the modeller that some conditions required by the framework are not met. Be sure to have a correct location, since the object and method that the error becomes apparent is not necessary the location it was produced in. The information about the simulation time is extracted from the experiment and must not be given as a parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the error that occured
java.lang.String : The class and method the error occured in
java.lang.String : The reason most probably responsible for the error to occur
java.lang.String : The measures a user should take to prevent this warning to be issued again

detaileddescription.para: Sets the experiment's status to the given integer value. The value must be in the legal range of [-1,5], otherwise a warning is issued.

parameterdescription.para: int : The integer value of the experiments' new status

detaileddescription.para: Sets the TimeFormatter to be used for output of time strings. Observe that if this method is called before creating an Experiment object, a non-null TimeFormatter passed to the Experiment's constructor will overwrite the setting of this method-

parameterdescription.para: TimeFormatter : the formatter to be used for formatting time Strings.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current DESMO-J version

simplesect.para: The string "2.4.0".

detaileddescription.para: Returns the DESMO-J license

parameterdescription.para: boolean: Include link (HTML, true) or not (plain text, false)

simplesect.para: The string "Apache License, Version 2.0", embedded in a HTML link tag (currently http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0) if html is set true.

detaileddescription.para: Experiment is the class that provides the infrastructure for running the simulation of a model. It contains all data structures necessary to simulate the model and takes care of all necessary output. To actually run an experiment, a new instance of the experiment class and a new instance of the desired model have to be created. To link both instances, call the connectToExperiment(Experiment e) method of the model instance and pass the new experiment as a parameter.
